plot: Bart gets bullied at a school dance, so Marge gets an anti-bullying law passed, which results in Homer being put in therapy for bullying Ned.

After the school bullies destroy Bart's dance trophy Marge persuades the town to pass an anti-bullying law - which some people abuse for personal revenge. However Ned Flanders' sons report Homer for exploiting their father and he is forced to attend a therapy group. As a result he becomes very humble and it is Ned who gets annoyed to think that Homer is being regarded as a hero before the two men finally reconcile.—don @ minifie-1
